informationService.name: CCS FlightDataDistribution
informationService.serviceAbstract:
This Service is part of Coflight Cloud Services (CCS), which are primarily designed to support the Virtual Centre concept. As such, these CCS Services support the interactions between the CCS ATM Data Service Provider (ADSP) and Virtual Centre Air Traffic Service Units (ATSUs). The CCS FlightDataDistribution service is consistent with the other CCS services. It supports:

- the distribution of Flight Plan information every time an update of a relevant Flight Plan is processed by the ADSP. The modifications of the Flight Plans can be triggered from several sources (other CWPs or functionality of the ADSP).

- The distribution of Erroneous AFTN messages information referred to FDO for manual correction, every time an AFTN message reception fails Coflight checks. This version of the service is intended to be used in 'test mission', which aims at providing services and support to the Customer(s) to enable them to test any version of their ATM system during development.

serviceProvision.providerDescription:
DSNA: the French air navigation service provider

ENAV; the Italian air navigation service provider

pointOfContact.name: Guillaume Ramonet
pointOfContact.description: Coflight Cloud Services Program Director - To request access to the CCS service

pointOfContact.name: Service Desk
pointOfContact.description: - For Incidents on services in operation, contact the Service desk [working hours/opening days] as described in the related support service (incident management) supplied by CCS provider to CCS customer during the procurement phase

operationalNeed.description:
CCS FlightDataManagement Service addresses the CWP manual interactions for managing Flight Plan updates related to inputs made by the controller or by the Flight Data Operator. It addresses operations related to:

- the System Flight Plan Data: Create, Cancel, Delete, Retrieve, Create Abbreviated and Non tactical modifications,

- to ATC Instructions: Holding, Heading, Speed, CFL, ROCD, EFL, XFL, DirectTo, ClearedTo, RFL and ECL,

- the correction of erroneous AFTN messages,

- WhatIf: Accept/Reject and Open/Close.

Note: in this version of the document, CCS FDM contains all the operations listed above except those related to WhatIf.

functionality.name: Functionality 1
functionality.description: Process a Cleared Flight Level instruction
functionality.realWorldEffect: The trajectory of the flight is updated accordingly.

functionality.name: Functionality 2
functionality.realWorldEffect: The trajectory of the flight is updated with the direct clearance.

qualityOfService.name: Services level objectives
qualityOfService.description: The service level objectives regarding the availability, response time, throughput and recoverability of CCS Services depend on the purpose (mission) for which the Customer intend to use them (e.g. integration, test, training, operational purpose).These service level objectives are therefore negotiated with the Customers, based on their safety analysis, and are detailed in the specific Service Level Agreement established with each CCS Customer.

qualityOfService.name: Network performance
qualityOfService.description: The minimum Bandwidth required to consume CCS services (hypothesis for the technical integration service of 300 simultaneous flight managed by the system) is 10MB/s.

qualityOfService.name: Rate limitation
qualityOfService.description: Customer ATSU shall restrict the overall rate of requests to a maximum of 720 request/minutes. The detailed rate limitation per services is detailed in the associated swim service description of each service.

informationDefinition.name: AFTNAddressType
informationDefinition.description: 8 LETTERS, being the 4-letter ICAO location indicator plus the 3-letter designator of the ATS unit followed by the letter X or, if applicable, the one-letter designator identifying the division of the ATS unit.

informationDefinition.name: AFTNFieldType
informationDefinition.description: The label of the AFTN field (ADEXP primary field or the ICAO sub-field):ADEXP: ADES, ADESOLD, ROUTE, WKTRC...ICAO: F3c, F9b, F15b, F81...

informationDefinition.name: AerodromeIdentificatorType
informationDefinition.description: Identifier of an aerodrome.

informationDefinition.name: AirSpeed
informationDefinition.description: Airspeed value expressed in knot or in mach.

informationDefinition.name: AircraftIDType
informationDefinition.description: The identifier of an aircraft

informationDefinition.name: AircraftMassType
informationDefinition.description: Aircraft mass in kilograms

informationDefinition.name: AircraftTypeType
informationDefinition.description: The designator(s) of the aircraft type(s) (e.g. B747).

informationDefinition.name: AirwayNameType
informationDefinition.description: The name by which the route is known.

informationDefinition.name: AltitudeValue
informationDefinition.description: Simple class providing an altitude value.

informationDefinition.name: Application
informationDefinition.description: This class gathers all the possible parameters specifying the start (application) and end (targetEnd) of the application of an ATC Instruction.These parameters can be specified by a point or a distance and their usage may be applicable depending on the type of ATC Instruction.

informationDefinition.name: ApplicationAddressType
informationDefinition.description: Address of the following applications:- for CM application, it represents the transport layer address.- for CPDLC, it represents the ATN address of the CPDLC application.- for ADS, it represents the ATN address of the ADS applications. Note: The field length shall be either 36 or 38 hexadecimal characters. The character "\0" is added to indicate a 36 characters' string end.

informationDefinition.name: ApplicationEnd
informationDefinition.description: This class encompasses all the parameters related to the end of an application: time, point, duration.The applicationEnd parameters are only applicable to CFL (routePointId), Route (routePointId), heading (point) and holding (point, absoluteTime, durationTime).absoluteTime and durationTime are mutually exclusive.

informationDefinition.name: ApplicationKindType
informationDefinition.description: The ATN Air-Ground application type.Note: 0 for ADS, 2 or 22 for CPDLC and 3 for ATI.

informationDefinition.name: ApplicationStart
informationDefinition.description: Common classThis class encompasses all the parameters related to the start of an application: point (current position), routePoint, distance and relativeDistance.Depending on the instructions, the applicationStart parameters can be either:-a point and/or a distance,or-a routePointId,or-a routePointId and a relativeDistance.Limitation CCS: the applicationStart parameters related to a time are not managed by CCS.

informationDefinition.name: ApplicationType
informationDefinition.description: The label of the application:Ex.: GGDA, GGDO, ASP, CONF, FDPS

informationDefinition.name: ApplicationVersionType
informationDefinition.description: Version of the Air-Ground application (ADS and CPDLC for FANS 1/A flights, ADS, CPDLC and ATI for ATN flights).Note: Defined as 1{'00'|'01}1 for FANS 1/A flights (ADS and CPDLC) and as 1{'00'|'01'|'02'}1 for ATN flights (ADS, CPDLC and ATI).

informationDefinition.name: BooleanType
informationDefinition.description: Boolean

informationDefinition.name: CodeAFTNMessageType
informationDefinition.description: Type of AFTN messageLimitation CCS : ACH and APL are not applicable to Coflight.

informationDefinition.name: CodeATXEmergencyStatusType
informationDefinition.description: Asterix062 definition of an emergency status.CCS uses only the 3 values below:-GENERAL_EMERGENCY, when code SSR = 7700,-NO_COMMUNICATIONS, when code SSR = 7600,-UNLAWFUL_INTERFERENCE, when code SSR = 7500.Limitation CCS: The other values are not handled by CCS.

informationDefinition.name: CodeAircraftCommunicationDefectType
informationDefinition.description: Possible error states of a radio channel or frequency.

informationDefinition.name: CodeBoundaryPointType
informationDefinition.description: Indicates how the boundary between two ATC will be crossed

informationDefinition.name: CodeConstraintStatusType
informationDefinition.description: Status supporting the state of a Constraint:ACTIVE: In this case, the constraint is active but not yet ongoing.ONGOING: The constraint is active and ongoing (i.e. its Application Point has been overflown).INACTIVE: A constraint ignored by profile prediction as it has been overridden by another constraint.TERMINATED: A constraint which is no longer ongoing.

informationDefinition.name: CodeCoordinationAndTransferStatusType
informationDefinition.description: Enumeration specifying the status of a coordination or transfer procedure:- ABROGATED: the coordination is abrogated (XFL change, re-route...).- ACCEPTED: the coordination or the proposal is accepted.- ASSUMED: the flight has been assumed by the receiving responsibility.- COMMUNICATION_SKIPPED: the transition is skipped (when the receiving responsibility is skipped and the transferring gets the control of the flight). - DEASSUMED: the assumed flight has been assumed by another unexpected responsibility.- FREQUENCY_CHANGED: the transfer is ongoing over the transition (ie. the receiving Sector is assumable).- HANDED_OVER: the flight is no longer under control of the receiving responsibility.- HANDOVER_ACCEPTED: a hand over proposal over the transition has been accepted.- HANDOVER_PROPOSED: a hand over proposal is ongoing over the transition.- INITIAL: initial state of a coordination dialogue.- NOTIFIED: to indicate the notification phase of this transition. - PROPOSED: a coordination proposal or counter-proposal is ongoing over the transition.- REJECTED: the coordination or the proposal is rejected.- RELEASED: the flight has been instructed to contact the  responsibility following the receiving responsibility.- REQUEST_ON_FREQUENCY: the frequency has been requested by the receiving responsibility.- TRANSFER_INITIATED: to indicate the initiation of the transfer phase for this transition (ie. OLDI TIM message).Limitation CCS: The following values are not handled by CCS: HANDOVER_REJECTED, NOT_RELEASED, RELEASE_REQUESTED.

informationDefinition.name: CodeDirectionIndicatorType
informationDefinition.description: The direction types:- DOWNSTREAM: coordination data for a downstream transition.- UPSTREAM: coordination data for an upstream transition.

informationDefinition.name: CodeDirectionTurnType
informationDefinition.description: Indicates the direction of a turn (left, right)

informationDefinition.name: CodeETOInvalidReason
informationDefinition.description: Enumeration indicating the reason of ETO invalidity:- INDEFINITE_HOLD: Holding without exit time.- INVALID_DISTANCE: Invalid distance- ROUTE_DISCONTINUITY: Temporal-spatial discontinuities (TP-AREA re-entrance and unknown route items).- SUSPENDED_FLIGHT: The flight is suspended.

informationDefinition.name: CodeEquipmentStatusType
informationDefinition.description: Enumeration indicating which equipment is available in an aircraft:- EQUIPPED: the flight is equipped and the equipment is available for use by the flight- NOT_EQUIPPED: the flight is not equipped or the flight is exempted to have the equipment or for any reason the equipment cannot be used by the flight.- UNKNOWN: the capability is unknown.

informationDefinition.name: CodeFlightPlanStatusType
informationDefinition.description: To indicate the current status of the flight plan:- ACTIVE: one of the internal SFPL segment is LIVE.- TERMINATED: the flight plan status is set to TERMINATED when all internal and external SFPL segments of controlled sectors are LEFT.- PASSIVE: when conditions to set it to ACTIVE or TERMINATED are not fulfilled.

informationDefinition.name: CodeFlightPlanType
informationDefinition.description: To indicate the type of the flight plan:- AFPL: the SFPL is an abbreviated flight plan (some ICAO basic fields only, no computed data).- SFPL: the SFPL is a full SFPL (with all ICAO basic fields and all computed data such as profile, distribution...).

informationDefinition.name: CodeFlightRulesStatusType
informationDefinition.description: Indicates the status of the flight rules in each Route Point (VFR or IFR)

informationDefinition.name: CodeFlightRulesType
informationDefinition.description: An indication of the flight rules which are applicable:- IFR if ICAO rule is I- VFR if ICAO rule is V- IFR_FIRST if ICAO rule is Y- VFR_FIRST if ICAO rule is Z

informationDefinition.name: CodeFlightType
informationDefinition.description: Flight category according to ICAO:- SCHEDULED: if ICAO type is S (scheduled air transport)- NOT_SCHEDULED: if ICAO type is N (non-scheduled air transport)- GENERAL: if ICAO type is G (general aviation)- MILITARY: if ICAO type is M (military flights)- OTHER: if ICAO type is X (other flights)

informationDefinition.name: CodeHeadingClearanceRestrictionType
informationDefinition.description: Code indicating the kind of restriction associated to a flight heading ATC clearance

informationDefinition.name: CodeHeadingType
informationDefinition.description: Enumeration which specifies the kind of heading of a clearance (absolute or relative)

informationDefinition.name: CodeHoldingStatusType
informationDefinition.description: Enumeration which indicates the status of a holding clearance (PLANNED_TO_HOLD, CLEARED_TO_HOLD, HOLDING, CLEARED_TO_LEAVE_HOLD)

informationDefinition.name: CodeIndicationROCDType
informationDefinition.description: NORMAL: Normal VRCD to use.EXPEDITE: Expedite VRCD to use.EMERGENCY: Emergency VRCD to use (only in descent).

informationDefinition.name: CodeLevelClearanceRestrictionType
informationDefinition.description: Code indicating the kind of restriction associated to a flight level ATC clearance:IMMEDIATE: this is a climb or descentCFL instruction.WHEN_READY: this is an inputCFL instruction.

informationDefinition.name: CodeMessageFormatType
informationDefinition.description: Format of the AFTN message. It can be ADEXP or ICAO

informationDefinition.name: CodeOldiMessageKindType
informationDefinition.description: To indicate the OLDI message corresponding to the C&T process.

informationDefinition.name: CodeProgressOfFlightType
informationDefinition.description: Indicates the state of progress of the flight related to the traversal of the AoR:  - NEAR_PLANNING: the flight is approaching the AoR (for external coordination) or the sector (for internal coordinations) at such distance/time that it is concerned by the coordination or the coordination has been forced manually.- NEAR_EXE: the flight is approaching the AoR at such distance/time that it is concerned by executive control.- ENTERED: the flight has entered the traversal of the AoR.- EXITED: the flight has exited the traversal of the AoR.

informationDefinition.name: CodeReferralType
informationDefinition.description: Indicates the kind of referral :-CORRECTION:Erroneous message referred for correction.-BLOCKED:Message potentially correct, referred because at least another erroneous message concerning the same SFPL has already been referred to FDO.-NOT_CHECKED:Message systematically referred to FDO without processing according to off-line configuration.

informationDefinition.name: CodeSSRModeType
informationDefinition.description: Code describing the different modes of surveillance.- MODE_3A : The identification of an aircraft as reported by its SSR transponder. This 12-bits code is manually set by the pilot on request of ATC. This code is often called the 'squawk identification' and is usually represented as 4 octal digits (e.g. 0627). Special codes are reserved for emergency situations (7500 = hijack, 7600 = radio failure, 7700 = general emergency). (often abbreviated as: SSR code).- MODE_A-C : The altitude of an aircraft as reported by its SSR transponder expressed in flight levels. Possible values are between FL 12 and FL 1267.- MODE_S : An enhanced mode of SSR which permits the interrogation of SSR equipped aircraft and addressed interrogations with two way data exchange for suitably equipped aircraft- INTERMODE : aircraft mode S equipped that can answer to mode A or mode C interrogations.

informationDefinition.name: CodeSectorStateType
informationDefinition.description: To indicate the possible use of a sector:DELEGATED: the sector responsibility has been delegated.SKIPPED: the sector responsibility has been manually skipped or automatically skipped.

informationDefinition.name: CodeSegmentCategoryType
informationDefinition.description: Indication of the segment category.This includes the possible segment categories according to their entry and exit conditions:The enumerate is a union of entry and exit conditions.Entry condition corresponds to:- DEPARTURE: internal segment containing the ADEP.- INBOUND: internal segment that doesn't contain the ADEP and has no upstream internal segment or its upstream internal Segment belongs to another ATSU- MIXED_IN: internal segment that doesn't contain the ADEP and has an upstream internal segment for which flight rule / flight type are different.Exit condition corresponds to:- ARRIVAL: internal segment containing the ADES.- OUTBOUND: internal segment that doesn't contain the ADES and has no downstream internal segment or its downstream internal Segment belongs to another ATSU- MIXED_OUT: internal segment that doesn't contain the ADES and has an downstream internal segment for which flight rule / flight type are different

informationDefinition.name: CodeSegmentClassType
informationDefinition.description: Enumeration which defines the class of a segment:For internal segments:CONTROLLED: Value for an internal segment corresponding to the traversal of a controlled ATSU.REGION: Value for an internal segment corresponding to the traversal of an ATSU of the region not controlled by the system instance.IOP: Value for an internal segment corresponding to the traversal of an ATSU of the IOP area not belonging to the region.OLDI: Value for an internal segment corresponding to the traversal of an OLDI ATSU not belonging to the region.AFTN: Value for an internal segment corresponding to the traversal of an AFTN ATSU not belonging to the region.UNKNOWN: Default value.For external segments:CONTROLLED: Value for an external segment corresponding to the traversal (AoI) of a controlled ATSU.NOT_CONTROLLED: Value for external segments other than CONTROLLED.

informationDefinition.name: CodeSegmentKindType
informationDefinition.description: Type of a Segment: - INTERNAL: Traversal of an ATSU AoR by an SFPL, for one flight rule (IFR/VFR) and one flight type (OAT/GAT) applicable in the traversal.- EXTERNAL: - Traversal of an ATSU AoI by an SFPL that does not enter the AoR, for one flight rule (IFR/VFR) and one flight type (OAT/GAT) applicable in the traversal.- Traversal of a military (resp. civil) ATSU AoI by a GAT (resp. OAT) flight.

informationDefinition.name: CodeSegmentStateType
informationDefinition.description: The state value of a segment.For internal segments:- MONITORED: default value: the controlled segment is created.- PENDING: the notification phase has been started for this controlled segment of the SFPL.- LIVE: the coordination phase has been started for this controlled segment of the SFPL. - LEFT: the transition to LEFT segment state occurs a delay (off-line predefined) after the flight has left the AOI of the controlled ATSU.-NONE: this is the fixed value of all internal SFPL segments which are not controlled by the system instance (i.e. all internal segments which class is REGION, IOP, OLDI, AFTN or UNKNOWN).For external segments:- PENDING: default value: controlled external segment created- LIVE: the flight is detected inside the controlled external segment AOI- LEFT: the transition to LEFT segment state occurs a delay (off-line predefined) after the flight has left the AOI of the controlled ATSU.- NONE: this is the fixed value of all external SFPL segments which are not controlled by the system instance (i.e. all external segment which class is NOT_CONTROLLED).

informationDefinition.name: CodeSpeedClearanceRestrictionType
informationDefinition.description: Code indicating the kind of restriction associated to a flight speed ATC clearanceLimitation CCS: the following values are not handled: DUAL_ASSIGNED, DUAL_MAXIMUM, DUAL_MINIMUM, KEYWORD, NONE.Only the following values are applicable to the speedConstraint: ASSIGNED, MAXIMUM, MINIMUM, RANGE.Only the following values are applicable to the speed ATC instruction: ASSIGNED, MAXIMUM, MINIMUM.

informationDefinition.name: CodeTrafficCategoryType
informationDefinition.description: Enumeration list to indicate if the attribute is GAT, OAT or MIXED:- GAT: General Air Traffic- OAT: Operational Air Traffic- MIXED: GAT/OAT mixed flight.

informationDefinition.name: CodeTrajectoryPointKindExtensionType
informationDefinition.description: Extension to characterize with additional information a point of the trajectory.BYPASSED_WAYPOINT: A trajectory point corresponding to a waypoint that is not overflown.TRACK_PROJECTION: A trajectory point corresponding to a position of a former projection of the track on the trajectory.INTRA_RESPONSIBILITY_TRANSITION: transition point between responsibilities sharing the same control volumes. The transition points are computed from the responsibility rule (offline defined) that identifies these responsibilities. The system has to know at least all responsibility rules of the region and those for responsibilities surrounding the region.DISCONTINUITY_POINT: A trajectory point corresponding to a trajectory calculation guess possibly due to issue(s) in the expanded route (for example used to handle re-entrant flights).TARGET_START_POINT: Start of the trajectory segment within a constraint scope where the constrained value has to be metTARGET_END_POINT: End of the trajectory segment within a constraint scope where the constrained value has to be metAIRWAY: A trajectory point corresponding to an airway waypoint (caveat: entry/exit points of airways are not considered as airway points)CDR: A trajectory point corresponding to the first point of a CDRMISSED_APPROACH: A trajectory point corresponding to a missed approach waypointIAP: A trajectory point corresponding to an IAP waypointSID: A trajectory point corresponding to a SID waypointSTAR: A trajectory point corresponding to a STAR waypoint

informationDefinition.name: CodeTrajectoryPointKindType
informationDefinition.description: Characterizes a point of the trajectory. ADEP: An estimated trajectory point belonging to the adep.ADES: An estimated trajectory point belonging to the ades.BOTTOM_OF_CLIMB: A trajectory point marking the transition from a cruise phase to a climb phase (kind not provided by CCS).BOTTOM_OF_DESCENT: A trajectory point marking the transition from a descent phase to a cruise phase (kind not provided by CCS).BOUNDARY_POINT: A trajectory point at which the 4D Trajectory intersects the boundary of an airspace.CONSTRAINT_APPLICATION: The point of application of a constraint.END_OF_TURN: A trajectory point corresponding to the end of a turn (kind not provided by CCS).END_PREDICTION_POINT: The final point at which a trajectory was made calculated.FROM_GAT_TO_OAT_POINT: A trajectory point at which the flight passes from GAT to OAT rules, indicating the start of a military portion of the route.FROM_IFR_TO_VFR_POINT: A trajectory point at which the flight passes from IFR to VFR rules, indicating the start of a VFR portion of the route.FROM_OAT_TO_GAT_POINT: A trajectory point at which the flight passes from OAT to GAT rules, indicating the end of a military portion of the route.FROM_VFR_TO_IFR_POINT: A trajectory point at which the flight passes from VFR to IFR rules, indicating the end of VFR portion of the route.HOLD_ENTRY_POINT: The point is the entry to a discontinuity area due to holding (STACK/AMA), STAY or En-route delay.HOLD_EXIT_POINT: The point at which the flight is expected to exit from planned holding.INITIAL_PREDICTION_POINT: The initial point at which a trajectory was calculated. INTERMEDIATE_POINT: A specific kind of point of the trajectory that represents no significant point, only a point that will be overflown (no distinction between horizontal and vertical intermediate points in SESAR).MIDDLE_OF_TURN: A trajectory point corresponding to a middle of a turn (kind not provided by CCS).ROUTE: A trajectory point corresponding to an expanded route point overfly.START_OF_TURN: A trajectory point corresponding to a start of a turn (kind not provided by CCS).TOP_OF_CLIMB: The trajectory point at which the trajectory arrives at the cruise flight level. TOP_OF_DESCENT: The trajectory point at which the trajectory begins a descent from the cruise flight level.Note: CCS only manages one TOP_OF_CLIMB and one TOP_OF_DESCENT. When the flight has several cruise levels (intermediate RFL/ECL inputs):  - the TOP_OF_CLIMB is at the highest level reached by the trajectory before a change of trend.  - the TOP_OF_DESCENT is where the trajectory leaves the level preceding a descent without a re-climb.

informationDefinition.name: CodeTransitionStatusType
informationDefinition.description: This indicates the state of a transition in the coordination phase to know if the relative data are applicable :- APPLICABLE: the transition data are applicable as coordination constraint (if any).- DELEG: the upstream responsibility has delegated the control of the flight to the one now placed as downstream, so the related coordination data are not applicable.- SAME_LP: the two responsibilities of the transition are mapped on the same LogicalCWP, so the related coordination data are not applicable.- SKIPPED: the downstream responsibility has sent a skip input and the upstream gets the control of the flight, so the related coordination data are not applicable.

informationDefinition.name: CodeUpdateCategoryType
informationDefinition.description: Enumeration to identify the category of the SFPL modification:-DAD_TIMER_UPD: automatic programmed event by DAD-ENV_UPDATE: ENV data update-FDM_TIMER_UPD: automatic programmed event by FDM-GGDC_EXCHANGE_FAILURE: The update is due to a message not sent or no message acknowledgement reception processing-IOP_UPDATE: input following the reception of an IOP exchange-MANUAL_UPDATE: manual input from an eligible operator-MSG_UPDATE: reception of an external message (IFPS, AFTN, OLDI...)-PRO_TIMER_UPD: automatic programmed event by PRO-RADAR_UPDATE: Automatic positioning report, or correlation eventSSR_TIMER_UPD: Automatic programmed event by SSRM

informationDefinition.name: CodeVFRFlightPlanStatusType
informationDefinition.description: This indicates the state of a flight plan of a VFR flight:- ALERTED: the INCERFA indicator is set for a routePointId (eq. ATO delay is out of bounds on this point).- SUPERVISED: the INCERFA indicator is not set.

informationDefinition.name: CodeWakeTurbulenceCategoryType
informationDefinition.description: Enumeration indicating the wake turbulence category of an aircraft

informationDefinition.name: CollectionStampType
informationDefinition.description: The value of the collection stamp.

informationDefinition.name: CommentLongType
informationDefinition.description: Generic type to address comment/description/remark attributes within a long length frame.

informationDefinition.name: CommentMediumType
informationDefinition.description: Generic type to address comment/description/remark attributes within a medium length frame

informationDefinition.name: CommentShortType
informationDefinition.description: Generic type to address comment/description/remark attributes within a short length frame.

informationDefinition.name: ConstraintIdType
informationDefinition.description: The unique and static identifier of the constraint

informationDefinition.name: Controller
informationDefinition.description: Identification of a specific controller (originator of a request, served for SFPL distribution, target/originator of a PointSession...).

informationDefinition.name: ControllerDesignatorType
informationDefinition.description: String to identify a controller.

informationDefinition.name: DatalinkLogonData
informationDefinition.description: Common Technical classData link ATN or FANS 1/A logon parameters.Note: When an aircraft did not indicate that it wants to use one of the applications, the associated AppVersion is set to "00" and the associated application address field is omitted in the LOF.

informationDefinition.name: DateImageType
informationDefinition.description: Date, expressed in string ("YYMMDD")

informationDefinition.name: DirectionIndicator
informationDefinition.description: Indicates the direction of the coordination proposal.The CoordinationData of real SFPL are always from the entry to the exit sector.

informationDefinition.name: DistributionKindType
informationDefinition.description: The Kind of the distribution:CONTROL: The SFPL is distributed for control purpose (depending on the control volumes offline pre-defined as a set responsibility rules).CONSULTATION: The SFPL is distributed for consultation purpose in a given what-if context, and the served controller is not the creator of this what-if context.CONSULTATION_CREATOR: The SFPL is distributed for consultation purpose in a given what-if context, and the served controller is the creator of this what-if context.DUPLICATED: The SFPL is distributed for duplication purpose. It may be an external duplication or a duplication from an IOP partners.GENERAL_INFORMATION: The SFPL is distributed for general information purpose (depending on the values of the SFPL data).POINTED: The SFPL is distributed due to a point flight sessionVICINITY: The SFPL is distributed for information in case of vicinity (depending on the interest volumes offline pre-defined as a set of information rules).Note: the distribution rules must have been offline pre-defined for each kind of distribution.

informationDefinition.name: EmergencyDataType
informationDefinition.description: This type indicates whether emergency is DECLARED or NOT_DECLARED).-NOT_DECLARED (default value)-DECLARED: when special SSR Code = 7700.

informationDefinition.name: Equipment
informationDefinition.description: A term designating any electronic device - including its electrical part - for use in an aircraft, including radio, automatic flight control and instrument systems.

informationDefinition.name: ErroneousMessageIdType
informationDefinition.description: Number indicating the Erroneous message identifier in the queue

informationDefinition.name: ErrorDescriptionType
informationDefinition.description: Generic type to address the description of an error in a FDO referred message.

informationDefinition.name: ErrorIdentifierType
informationDefinition.description: Identifier of the error.

informationDefinition.name: ErrorParameterType
informationDefinition.description: A string supporting the value of a parameter in an error description.

informationDefinition.name: ErrorPositionType
informationDefinition.description: The position (Nth character) of the error.

informationDefinition.name: FillingTimeImageType
informationDefinition.description: Type supporting a date, expressed in string ("DDHHMM")

informationDefinition.name: FlightIdentifier
informationDefinition.description: Flight Identifier

informationDefinition.name: FlightIdentifierType
informationDefinition.description: Type supporting a unique flight identifier that can be : an internal flight Id assigned by the FDPS, an IFPLIdentifier, an aircraftRegistration, a flightNumber...

informationDefinition.name: FlightLevelOrAltitude
informationDefinition.description: Level value expressed in Flight Level or in altitude.

informationDefinition.name: FlightLevelType
informationDefinition.description: The flight level to climb/descend to.

informationDefinition.name: FlightLevelValue
informationDefinition.description: Simple class providing an FL value.

informationDefinition.name: FrequencyValueType
informationDefinition.description: Value of the frequency expressed in MHz

informationDefinition.name: GeographicalPoint
informationDefinition.description: Geographical Point definition of a Significant Point.

informationDefinition.name: HeadingClearanceRestrictionKind
informationDefinition.description: Gives information about the application of the flight heading clearance

informationDefinition.name: HeadingType
informationDefinition.description: Heading type angle in degrees.

informationDefinition.name: HoldingVolumeIdentifierType
informationDefinition.description: Holding Identifier in which the flight must be hold.

informationDefinition.name: ICAOCodeType
informationDefinition.description: 24-bit address unequivocally identifying an aircraft and assigned by the State where an aircraft is registered in accordance with standards established by ICAO for Mode S transponders.

informationDefinition.name: ICAORouteType
informationDefinition.description: A string of points (and connecting airways or DCTs where applicable) describing an ATS route or path of xes no more than 30 minutes ying time or 200nm apart, including those points where a change of speed, level, track, or flight rules is planned. Points can be listed by their coded designator (i.e. LN, MAY, HADDY), a 7 or 11-character representation of their coordinates (i.e. 46N078W, 4620N07805W), or a point relative to a reference point based on bearing and distance (i.e. DUB190040 being 40nm out on the 190 degree magnetic bearing from DUB). Change of speed and/or level is indicated by appending data formatted as in 15 CRUISING SPEED and LEVEL to a point, after a slash (i.e. MAY/N0305F180, 46N078W/M082F330). Change of flight rules are shown by a standalone VFR or IFR to indicate the beginning of that phase of flight.

informationDefinition.name: IFPLIdentifierType
informationDefinition.description: Type supporting an IFPLIdentifier.Represents the IFPS allocated unique identifier received from the NM-IFPS (expressed as a string of a fixed number of alphanumeric that consists of 2 letters followed by 8 digits).

informationDefinition.name: IndicatedAirSpeed
informationDefinition.description: Simple class providing an IAS value.

informationDefinition.name: LatitudeType
informationDefinition.description: Latitude expressed in decimal degrees

informationDefinition.name: LevelClearanceRestrictionKind
informationDefinition.description: Type of restriction.Gives information about the application of the level clearance

informationDefinition.name: LongitudeType
informationDefinition.description: Longitude expressed in decimal degrees

informationDefinition.name: MachNumber
informationDefinition.description: Simple class providing a mach value.

informationDefinition.name: MessageIdType
informationDefinition.description: Generic type to address the logical AFTN message type.

informationDefinition.name: MessageTextType
informationDefinition.description: Generic string type to address a raw message or the content of a long text field (otherInformation, specificADEXPField...).

informationDefinition.name: NCAEquipment
informationDefinition.description: Navigation, radio communication and approach aid equipment.

informationDefinition.name: NumberOfAircraftType
informationDefinition.description: The number of aircrafts (greater than 1 in case of formation flights).

informationDefinition.name: OriginalEventType
informationDefinition.description: The event code at the origin of the last update.

informationDefinition.name: OtherOEExtension
informationDefinition.description: Other operational entity mapped on the originator working position.Note: Even if the originator is a single controller, he may belong to a logical position composed of several operational entities (several Role/Responsibility couples).

informationDefinition.name: PointSessionIdType
informationDefinition.description: Integer to identify a PointSession.

informationDefinition.name: Position2D
informationDefinition.description: Two-dimensional point expressed in latitude and longitude.

informationDefinition.name: Position3D
informationDefinition.description: Three-dimensional point expressed in latitude, longitude and altitude.

informationDefinition.name: Position4D
informationDefinition.description: Four-dimensional point expressed in latitude, longitude, altitude and time.

informationDefinition.name: ProcedureIdentifierType
informationDefinition.description: Designator of a procedure

informationDefinition.name: PublishedPoint
informationDefinition.description: Published Point definition of a Significant Point.

informationDefinition.name: ROCDType
informationDefinition.description: Rate of Climb or Decent, respectively + or -.Expressed in Feet/Minute

informationDefinition.name: RadialPoint
informationDefinition.description: Radial Point definition of a Significant Point.

informationDefinition.name: ReasonType
informationDefinition.description: Express the reason of distribution

informationDefinition.name: ResponsibilityType
informationDefinition.description: String to identify a Responsibility.

informationDefinition.name: RouteElement
informationDefinition.description: A route element may be either an airway or (exclusive) a published point name.Upstream or downstream truncation of an airway to be used is to be made in conjunction with a previous or next RouteElement providing the corresponding point name.

informationDefinition.name: RoutePointIdType
informationDefinition.description: String identifying a route point.This is the identifier of an expanded route point.

informationDefinition.name: RunwayDesignatorType
informationDefinition.description: The full textual designator of the runway, used to uniquely identify it at an aerodrome/heliport

informationDefinition.name: SSRCodeType
informationDefinition.description: Mode A/S value of the transponder.4-digit octal representation

informationDefinition.name: SectorListIdType
informationDefinition.description: System reference number to identify the Sector by pointing to its position in the list of controlSector

informationDefinition.name: SegmentDesignatorType
informationDefinition.description: String to identify a segment

informationDefinition.name: SignificantPoint
informationDefinition.description: A specified geographical location used in defining an ATS route or the flight path of an aircraft and for other navigation and ATS purposes.A SignificantPoint can be defined as a PublishedPoint, a GeographicalPoint or a RadialPoint.

informationDefinition.name: SignificantPointDesignatorType
informationDefinition.description: Name of a significant point.Note: ICAO norm maximum length is 5 characters.

informationDefinition.name: SpeedClearanceRestrictionKind
informationDefinition.description: Gives information about the application of the flight speed clearanceNote: only applicable to CCS FDD, not to CCS FDM.

informationDefinition.name: SpeedKtsType
informationDefinition.description: A speed value, expressed in knot.

informationDefinition.name: SurveillanceCapabilityType
informationDefinition.description: A string indicating the SSR and ADS capability of the aircraft.

informationDefinition.name: TechStampType
informationDefinition.description: The version number of an item.

informationDefinition.name: TerminalRouteType
informationDefinition.description: SID or STAR designator

informationDefinition.name: TimeDateType
informationDefinition.description: Number of seconds since the Unix epoch time - 00.00 hours - Jan, 1st, 1970 (UTC).

informationDefinition.name: TimeDayType
informationDefinition.description: Number of seconds since beginning of current day (UTC)

informationDefinition.name: TimeDurationMinuteType
informationDefinition.description: Duration or interval in minutes. Decimal part may be used to refine precision with additional seconds.It may be negative when representing a time to lose.

informationDefinition.name: TimeImageType
informationDefinition.description: Time expressed in HHMM

informationDefinition.name: TimeStampDateType
informationDefinition.description: Number of milliseconds since the Unix epoch time - 00.00 hours - Jan, 1st, 1970 (UTC).

informationDefinition.name: TrajectoryPointIdType
informationDefinition.description: Index identifying the trajectory point in string format.

informationDefinition.name: UnitDesignatorType
informationDefinition.description: A distinguishing label, term, abbreviation or acronym used to identify the Unit.

informationDefinition.name: WhatIf
informationDefinition.description: WhatIf class is used in the FlightDataDistribution service to indicate if the published FlightData is a copy of the real flight used to negotiate potential changes without affecting the corresponding data of the actual flight. The WhaIf is used in the following operations of CoordinationAndTransferManagement:coordinationAccept, coordinationRejection, coordinationCounterProposal.The WhaIf is used in the following probing operations of FlightDataManagement:- requestProcessCFL- requestProcessDirect- requestProcessECL- requestProcessEFL- requestProcessHeading- requestProcessHolding- requestProcessRFL- requestProcessROCD- requestProcessRoute (CCS limitation)- requestProcessXFL

informationDefinition.name: WhatIfContextIDType
informationDefinition.description: Unique identifier of a what-if context in the CCS system.

informationDefinition.name: AFTNMessageData
informationDefinition.description: Class supporting the generic data of AFTN messages.

informationDefinition.name: ATCInstruction
informationDefinition.description: Directives issued by air traffic control for the purpose of requiring a pilot to take a specific action.

informationDefinition.name: Aircraft
informationDefinition.description: Any machine that can derive support in the atmosphere from the reactions of the air other than the reactions of the air against the earth's surface.

informationDefinition.name: AlternativeDestinationAerodrome
informationDefinition.description: The indicator of the alternative arrival aerodrome for the flight

informationDefinition.name: Arrival
informationDefinition.description: The set of flight operations following procedures associated to the destination aerodrome.

informationDefinition.name: BasicFlightPlanInfo
informationDefinition.description: This class represents some Basic FP Information relevant for some FlightDataManagement operations.

informationDefinition.name: COPData
informationDefinition.description: Coordination point data.

informationDefinition.name: ClearedFlightLevel
informationDefinition.description: To process the input of a Cleared Flight Level given a FP identification and the value of the level.

informationDefinition.name: ClearedROCD
informationDefinition.description: Cleared information related to a ROCD

informationDefinition.name: ClearedTo
informationDefinition.description: Instruction to proceed via the specified route.

informationDefinition.name: Constraint
informationDefinition.description: ATC constraint characterizing the impact of any input, flight intent or ATM restriction, on the trajectory of flight. This includes ATC Tactical constraints, i.e. constraints issued by controller inputs corresponding to instructions actually given or instructions planned to be given to the pilot.

informationDefinition.name: ConstraintIdentifierExtension
informationDefinition.description: The unique and static identifier of the constraint.

informationDefinition.name: ControlData
informationDefinition.description: This class provides relevant information of the control of the flight.

informationDefinition.name: ControlSector
informationDefinition.description: Is a type of Sector whose volume (or other airspace element if defined for the Sector) and assigned responsibility meets the characteristics of the flight.The group of all the ControlSectors is referred as the list of Control Sectors denoted by the multiplicity of this class.

informationDefinition.name: CoordinationAndTransfer
informationDefinition.description: This class supports a coordination and transfer process as a change of the controlling Sector and gathers all the data relevant for the Sectors involved in the process (CoordinationData, TransferData, transition data, Dialogue...).ControlSectors and InformedSectors can be involved in a coordination and transfer process as receiving or transferring Sectors.The model supports Coordination And Transfer processes between Sectors that are partOf the same Unit (internal coordination) or partOf different Units (external coordination).

informationDefinition.name: CoordinationData
informationDefinition.description: Data on the transition point between two sectors of the same ATC unit or from adjacent units.Note: by default, the transition point is the entry point of the receiving sector (responsibility). The entry of an AoR is determined either by the entry of the control volume, a segment transition point (if the 2 sectors belong to different segments), or according to the pre-defined responsibility rules if more than one responsibility is determined from a control volume.

informationDefinition.name: DatalinkIndicators
informationDefinition.description: Technical classThe datalink indicators for an ATSU.

informationDefinition.name: Departure
informationDefinition.description: The phase of a flight which starts with the ground handling of the aircraft and ends with the takeoff of the aircraft.

informationDefinition.name: Dialogue
informationDefinition.description: Specific information related to the exchange of coordination and transfer messages.

informationDefinition.name: EmergencyData
informationDefinition.description: A generic term meaning, as the case may be, uncertainty phase, alert phase or distress phase.

informationDefinition.name: ErroneousAFTNMessage
informationDefinition.description: Erroneous AFTN message.

informationDefinition.name: FlightData
informationDefinition.description: Class comprising all the Flight Data required for a flight to be distributed to CWPs (not constraining its use) supporting ATS operations.

informationDefinition.name: FlightDataInfo
informationDefinition.description: Specified information provided to air traffic services units, relative to an intended flight or portion of a flight of an aircraft.

informationDefinition.name: FlightDataMessage
informationDefinition.description: Message definition for Flight Data

informationDefinition.name: FlightDataMessages
informationDefinition.description: Message definition for Flight Data

informationDefinition.name: FlightHeading
informationDefinition.description: Instruction to fly on the specified heading.

informationDefinition.name: FlightPlanInfo
informationDefinition.description: Class used to gather the input parameters of some FlightDataManagement operations. It extends BasicFlightPlanInfo class, whose data is also used by the operations requiring FlightPlanInfo attributes as input parameters.

informationDefinition.name: FlightSpeed
informationDefinition.description: Manual Assigned Speed Input: Assign speed instruction.The parameters assignedSpeed, maximumSpeed and minimumSpeed are mutually exclusive.Note: the controller cannot input a speed range (min and max at the same time).

informationDefinition.name: HeadingConstraintExtension
informationDefinition.description: A heading constraint given to the flight. The aircraft will leave its route taking a given heading.

informationDefinition.name: Holding
informationDefinition.description: Instruction to enter a holding pattern with the published characteristics at the specified position and level.Note: instruction not applicable to coordination or transfer proposal in PJ16.

informationDefinition.name: HoldingVolume
informationDefinition.description: Data that contains all HOLD crossing areas

informationDefinition.name: InformedSector
informationDefinition.description: Is a type of Sector whose volume is of interest. This InformedSector list is populated with the AOI responsibilities crossed by the SFPL and satisfying specified SFPL conditions. The InformedSector list is determined by application of off-line defined information rules. Examples of informations rules criteria: interest volume, SFPL criteria (ADEP, ADES...), SFPL segment criteria (flight rule, flight type...) The group of all the InformedSectors is referred as the list of Informed Sectors denoted by the multiplicity of this class.

informationDefinition.name: InstrumentApproachProcedure
informationDefinition.description: A series of predetermined manoeuvres by reference to flight instruments or it may also be an extended list of points for the STAR or SID.

informationDefinition.name: LevelConstraintExtension
informationDefinition.description: A constraint defined by an objective to set the cleared flight level for the flight.

informationDefinition.name: ListOE
informationDefinition.description: Technical ClassRequest message for the CCS getFlightData operation.

informationDefinition.name: OceanicClearanceData
informationDefinition.description: The information associated with an oceanic clearance.

informationDefinition.name: OnGoingCommunications
informationDefinition.description: Represents the Sectors/Units (actors) involved in the on-going radio communications supporting the  Transfer process. These actors may differ from the  Transfer Sectors/Units transferring or receiving the Flight.NOTE: There can only be one on-going radio communication at the same time for the same flight whereas there could be several  Transfer on-going Dialogues for the same flight.

informationDefinition.name: PointSession
informationDefinition.description: This class is provided when a point session is established. A pointSession is used to mark an specific flight in order to highlight it in other HMIs, such internal or external to the ATSU

informationDefinition.name: ProceedDirectTo
informationDefinition.description: Instruction to proceed directly to the specified position

informationDefinition.name: ProposedCoordinationData
informationDefinition.description: This class supports the proposal or counter-proposal data that can take place in a negotiation during a coordination phase.Several proposals may exist during the negotiation of the coordination data.

informationDefinition.name: ROCDInstructions
informationDefinition.description: The flight's cleared rate of climb or rate of descend.The assignedROCD, maximumROCD and minimumROCD are mutually exclusive.Note: the controller cannot input an ROCD range (min and max at the same time).

informationDefinition.name: Route
informationDefinition.description: This is the expanded route: the ordered list of route points  resulting from route expansion (including items from standard procedures and route across points).Note: the route across points are filled with the coordinates of the route point (not with the coordinates of the projected point, the coordinates of the projection are available in the trajectory).

informationDefinition.name: RoutePoint
informationDefinition.description: A specified geographical location used in defining an ATS route or the flight path of an aircraft and for other navigation and ATS purposes

informationDefinition.name: SSRCode
informationDefinition.description: The number assigned to a particular multiple pulse reply signal transmitted by a transponder in Mode A or Mode C.

informationDefinition.name: Sector
informationDefinition.description: The Area of Responsibility of a Unit is internally represented by a group of Sectors. They are the smallest entities that can be assigned to a controller or a group of controllers for ATM purposes.A Sector could be first defined by a volume or other airspace element such as STAR, an airway or a group of airways and has a responsibility assigned for controlling purposes. The responsibility can depend on several criteria:- Type of airspace controlled (ACC, APP,...)- Type of traffic.- Type of aircraft.- etc.Sectors shall be either ControlSectors or InformedSectors and are linked to the Unit they are partOf to support external coordination.

informationDefinition.name: Segment
informationDefinition.description: Internal or external segment.Internal segment: Traversal of an ATSU AoR by an SFPL, for one flight rule (IFR/VFR) and one flight type (OAT/GAT) applicable in the traversal.External segment: Traversal of an ATSU AoI by an SFPL that does not enter the AoR, for one flight rule (IFR/VFR) and one flight type (OAT/GAT) applicable in the traversal.

informationDefinition.name: SegmentIdentifier
informationDefinition.description: Unique and fixed identifier of the segment.

informationDefinition.name: ServedController
informationDefinition.description: The list of the controllers served for any purpose (control, vicinity, general information, duplication or point), with the reason of distribution.Note: the distribution rules must have been offline pre-defined for each kind of distribution.

informationDefinition.name: SpeedConstraintExtension
informationDefinition.description: A speed constraint.It can be a speed to be used by the aircraft (at speed), a minimum speed (above speed) or a maximum speed (below speed).

informationDefinition.name: Trajectory
informationDefinition.description: The description of movement of an aircraft both in the air and on the ground including position, time, and at least via calculation, speed and acceleration.Note: the trajectory includes the projected points of route across points (BYPASSED_WAYPOINT).

informationDefinition.name: TrajectoryPoint
informationDefinition.description: A four dimensional point used in defining the flight path of an aircraft.

informationDefinition.name: TrajectoryPointKind
informationDefinition.description: Characterizes a point of the trajectory.

informationDefinition.name: TrajectoryPointKindExtension
informationDefinition.description: Extension to characterize with additional information a point of the trajectory.

informationDefinition.name: TransferData
informationDefinition.description: Transfer data that can be exchanged or proposed during the transfer phase:- A speed - A rate of climb / descent - A heading- A flight level - A direct,- A supplementary flight level.

informationDefinition.name: UpdateReason
informationDefinition.description: Technical classThe reason that led to an SFPL modification.

informationDefinition.name: Warning
informationDefinition.description: Coordination warning dataNote: due to late PJ16.03 definition, calculatedXFL and calculatedSector are not provided in this CCS version.

informationDefinition.name: WhatIf
informationDefinition.description: WhatIf class is used in the FlightDataDistribution service to indicate if the published FlightData is a copy of the real flight used to negotiate potential changes without affecting the corresponding data of the actual flight. The WhaIf is used in the following operations of CoordinationAndTransferManagement:coordinationAccept, coordinationRejection, coordinationCounterProposal.The WhaIf is used in the following probing operations of FlightDataManagement:- requestProcessCFL- requestProcessDirect- requestProcessECL- requestProcessEFL- requestProcessHeading- requestProcessHolding- requestProcessRFL- requestProcessROCD- requestProcessRoute (CCS limitation)- requestProcessXFL

serviceMonitoring.monitoringDescription: CCS services are supervised in real time by trained and licensed ATSEPS. A dedicated service to supervise the complete CCS swim services portfolio is available to the customer.For more information, please refer to the swim service description of the CCS technical supervision distribution service

securityMechanism.name: Mutual authentication with X509 certificates
securityMechanism.description: Mutual authentication with X509 certificates is used between the AMQP broker and its client established within a TLS session

securityMechanism.name: TLS 1.2
securityMechanism.description: TLS 1.2 is used to provide confidentiality and integrity at transport layer.

securityMechanism.name: IPsec v4
securityMechanism.description: IPsec is used to provide confidentiality, authentication and integrity at network (internet) layer

technicalConstraint.description: CCS provider and CCS customer use the date and time for the operation of each service and they must be able to date the traces and the information passed to the SSI log collector. NTP is the standard solution to synchronize time accurately. So, CCS Provider and CCS Customer should use, each of them, at least one NTP server (stratum N), integrated in a NTP network containing a stratum 0 reference time clock.

Each services interface of the CCS business services relies on the concept of AMQP queues and topics. -The CCS customer shall use an implementation of the AMQP 1.0 specification to connect to the CCS provider AMQP 1.0 endpoint. -The CCS provider endpoint is an AMQP 1.0 broker managing queue and topics. The message payloads are encoded following a protobuf format. The message exchange patterns used by the CCS services are request/reply and publish/subscribe. The CCS customer acts as requester and subscriber. The CCS provider acts as responder and publisher.Concerning publish-subscribe, the CCS customer subscribes to a CCS distribution service by directly listening to an appropriate AMQP topic, which name follows the CCS derivation rules.The subscription to CCS Distribution Services is not performed via subscription operations, but by connecting to the appropriate AMQP Topic described in the .protobuf files as topic://<NameSpaceName>.<ServiceInterfaceName>.<LogicalOperation>The subscribers can filter the messages they want to receive by using the filter parameters defined for each subscription operation.Please note that, after subscribing to a CCS Distribution Service, the current repository of messages needs to be obtained from CCS via the get<MessageRepository> operation defined for each CCS Distribution Service(see "Subscription" section of the distribution operation of the service).N.B:-If the CCS platform restarts while the Customer is connected to the AMQP Broker, the current repository of messages is published again.-The acknowledgement that a Customer receives to his request ("RequestReport") may be received after the data distribution that this request has triggered, as these two messages are managed asynchronously by AMQP Queues and Topics.-More generally, since the distribution events from different services are asynchronous (independent CORRD/FDD... topics), they may be received in an unexpected sequence during a short time (a few ms) before reaching consistency.Concerning request-reply the CCS customer sends a request by sending a message to an appropriate AMQP queue, which name follows the CCS derivation rules, to make a request. The request message contains the name of the queue into the CCS customer listens and in which the reply from the CCS provider is expected.
The Customer is the one that initiates the TCP connection and in case of a Network / Connection failure, it is the responsibility of the CCS customer to try to reconnect regularly.

The AMQP broker creates the physical resources associated with a destination (queue, topic) on demand when messages are actually sent to them.Permissions on queues and topics (read/write access) are granted based on intended usage. The CCS customer will have: -Write access on the request queue-Read access on the reply queue -Read access on the topic for distribution service

serviceInterface.name: FlightDataDistributionProvider
serviceInterface.description: This Service Interface exposes the technical operation that allows the consumer to get the current flight plan data of all flights on request. It is typically used when starting the Service, for initialisation.
serviceInterface.interfaceBindingDescription: Information is exchanged in Protobuf format. Protocol buffers or Protobuf are Google's language-neutral, platform-neutral, extensible mechanism for serializing structured data similar to XML, but smaller, faster, and simpler.

operation.name: getFlightData
operation.description: Allows a consumer to get the applicable flight plan data related to all relevant flights concerning this consumer.

operationMessage.name: ListOE
operationMessage.description: Technical ClassRequest message for the CCS getFlightData operation.

behaviour.name: Service behaviour
behaviour.description: The detailed behavior of the service is provided in each operation dedicated section

endPoint.name: FlightDataDistributionProvider
endPoint.address: For security reasons, the adresses will be communicated only to Customers

serviceInterface.name: FlightDataSubscriber
serviceInterface.description: This Service Interface exposes one operation for publishing updates of flight plan data on a specific flight immediately when updated.
serviceInterface.interfaceBindingDescription: Information is exchanged in Protobuf format. Protocol buffers or Protobuf are Google's language-neutral, platform-neutral, extensible mechanism for serializing structured data similar to XML, but smaller, faster, and simpler.

operation.name: publishFlightDataDistribution
operation.description: This operation sends the flight plan data of a flight when it is updated.

behaviour.name: Service behaviour
behaviour.description: The detailed behavior of the service is provided in each operation dedicated section

endPoint.name: FlightDataSubscriber
endPoint.address: For security reasons, the adresses will be communicated only to Customers

serviceInterface.name: ErroneousFlightDataSubscriber
serviceInterface.description: This Service Interface exposes one operation for publishing the erroneous AFTN message information for FDO correction.
serviceInterface.interfaceBindingDescription: Information is exchanged in Protobuf format. Protocol buffers or Protobuf are Google's language-neutral, platform-neutral, extensible mechanism for serializing structured data similar to XML, but smaller, faster, and simpler.

operation.name: publishErroneousAFTNMessageData
operation.description: This operation sends the erroneous AFTN messages information for FDO correction.
operation.precondition: The consumer has to define off-line the priority for each kind of external message: -1: the message is referred.-0: the message is not referred.

processingConsideration.description: The flightIdentifier is not processed by CCS for this operation (it is mentioned for interoperability purpose only).
When the operator uses the raw mode, the fields originatorAddress and receiverAddressees are ignored.
The system performs syntactic and semantic validity checks on each message corrected by FDO.

Whatever the type of ADEXP message to be corrected, CCS does not constraint the list of the decoded fields that can be allowed (see the ICAO reference documentation to check the ADEXP fields that can be provided in an IFPL message); the required checks are performed by Coflight
If the request is successful, the corrected message is sent for processing and the system deletes the corresponding erroneousAFTNMessage from its local database.

behaviour.name: Service behaviour
behaviour.description: The detailed behavior of the service is provided in each operation dedicated section
